fields.summary: Calendar name does not show up in month view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50855].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create JIRA project
2. Add some custom fields to that project
3. Go to Confluence and add a JIRA calendar
4. Select the custom fields you created

Outcome:
You get this error:
{code}Error(s) occurred.

    Unable to load events of Custom Date Support Test (06ed379b-eda0-4e1e-9746-015fc0f1937a): Unable to read response from http://feedback.onjira.com/rest/ical/1.0/ical/project/TEAMCAL/events.ics?_=1321338206911&dateFieldName=versiondue&dateFieldName=customfield_10530&dateFieldName=customfield_10531&includeFixVersions=true as iCalendar text. You may want to check the connection to feedback.onjira.com JIRA

{code}
fields.summary: Custom field date-time field does not work
Confluence gets timeout before JIRA Team Calendar responds when project issues have custom date fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50850].
  {panel}

I'm in the process of transferring calendars created with the free plugin to team calendar.
One of the calendars contains recurring events  such as "Every thursday, between 10 november 2011 and 18 feb 2012"
When I import this calendar into the team calendar, these events are interpreted as a single event running from 10 november until 18 february.
Check screenshot.

!^screenshot-1.jpg!

This make the team calendar completely unusable.
fields.summary: Import ICS - wrong interpretation of repeat events
"What" entry is reset when selecting a different calendar during Create Event
Null event description causes JS error
German Umlaute are not exported correctly to Google Calendar
Setup Team Calendars - select timezone dropdown display issue in IE >= 8
Jira Calenders can be viewed only by one user and cannot be added to a page
Cannot drag and drop JIRA Calendar
Change of characters (from "-->" to "--&gt")  while moving Team calendar entries

fields.description: If you type in a group name in the user picker and hit enter, your cursor jumps back up to the calendar name (instead of staying in the field).
fields.summary: Typing in a group name calendar restrictions and pressing enter moves the cursor to the top dialog

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem:

# Create a repeating event (e.g. weekly repeating event)
# Delete on of the recurrence (Team Calendars show just fine)
# Subscribe to the calendar from a calendar program (e.g. OS X iCal - tested with the one that comes with Lion)

Deleted events still visible in calendar program.
fields.summary: Deleted recurrence still show in iCalendar export (subscribe)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50832].
  {panel}

* Add a Calendar
* Insert the calendar onto a page using the calendar macro
* Delete the calendar

Expected: The macro should give some sort of error to show the user that is no longer valid
Actual: The calendar continues to display, but will not load any events. The spinner appears, and does not go away. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Calendar macro does not throw an error on an invalid id
OSGI dependency error on Confluence 4.2
NPE when adding gCal calendar by URL in Studio
Team Calendars: People Calendar - Crowd server

When they run on a single node, Team Calendars works. 

Share Plugin has the same problem:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22352

We seemed to have fixed the underlying problem in Confluence 4.0
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-4335

Original Support ticket
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-75666
fields.summary: Team Calendars notification broken on 3.5.13 clustered

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50825].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Download the attached smthsmth.ics
# Navigate to Team Calendars in Confluence, then {{Add Calendar >> Import Calendar}} and upload the downloaded smthsmth.ics
# Notice that the page throws the NPE

h3.Cause
Missing UID attribute in the ICS file. 

h3.Workaround
Add a UID attribute in between BEGIN:VEVENT and END:VEVENT of the ICS file:
*BEFORE*:
{code}
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTEND;TZID=Europe/London;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20120122T080000
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/London;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20120122T000000
ATTENDEE:smth@smth.com
URL:https://smth.smth.com/schedsdd
SUMMARY:sdsdsd
END:VEVENT
{code}
*AFTER*:
{code}
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTEND;TZID=Europe/London;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20120122T080000
DTSTART;TZID=Europe/London;VALUE=DATE-TIME:20120122T000000
UID:M0R7ZUPB8R6WUNL2OOMGUGFFH1NDGBJC
ATTENDEE:smth@smth.com
URL:https://smth.smth.com/schedsdd
SUMMARY:sdsdsd
END:VEVENT
{code}
Do this for all events (UID must be unique), and reupload the ICS file again.
fields.summary: Missing UID attribute in VEVENT causes NullPointerException

fields.summary: Team Calendars not working correctly in clustered Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50823].
  {panel}

Google peeks at the Content-Type to determine how to render the imported calendar. Team Calendars currently publishes the following header:

Content-Type: text/calendar

But the content is UTF-8, so Google will render it with invalid non-ASCII characters (since it seems to default to ISO-8859-1). The header should be changed to:

Content-Type: text/calendar; charset=UTF-8

I have tested this by downloading the subscribed calendar from Team Calendars and then did a small PHP script that patched this header when importing with a successful result.
fields.summary: Calendar added to Google gets assigned the wrong charset
Does the Team Calnedar plugin support Confluence cluster?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50820].
  {panel}

Hi,

Steps to reproduce it:
# Login as the account 'user1'.
# Add new Event Calendar 'Sample'.
# Add new event:
** What - 'イベント１'.
** Description - 'イベントの説明'.
# Logout 'user1'.
# Login as the account 'user2'.
# Add the Event Calendar 'Sample' to My Calendars.
# Back to Dashboard.
# Upcoming Events view and the dialog to edit the event output escaping characters in its Description.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa

fields.description:
So when users switch language preferences they expect to see their date formatting to change (eg. start of the week switched to Sunday for the US Language pack).

The date format for the Dashboard does not change as expected however (seeing dd/mm instead of mm/dd). 

See !dashboard.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date format in Dashboard is not internationalized
X more events appear under each event in a day in the list view if there are more than 10 events that fall on the day
Change PUT and DELETE to POST with X-HTTP-Method-Override header

fields.description:
If you have the following setup: Confluence 3.5.11, TEAMCAL 1.2.4 (and higher?), and have never configured a "Global Logo" at https://<confluence base url>/admin/configuregloballogo.action and then you perform the following actions:

Step 1: Turn on global logo option
Step 2: Upload custom logo
Step 3: Turn off global logo

Result: calendar macros (weekly list mode is what i saw) for TEAMCAL now show the global logo uploaded in step 2 as icon next to events on events, except external subscriptions.  User found it before I did and to fix I did:

Step 4: turn on global logo
Step 5: click the "Reset logo to default" link at https://<confluence base url>/admin/configuregloballogo.action
Step 6: turn off global logo

Result: back to default atlassian icon on the cal macros.


I assume that the effect should be that when "Global Logo" is set to "Off" at https://<confluence base url>/admin/configuregloballogo.action that the logo is not displayed ANYWHERE.  So, filing this as a TEAMCAL bug as this project should check to see if logo is on or off.

But if your response is going to be "Well, the logo was uploaded, so the problem is not in the plugin, but in Confluence code!" -- then this is a bug in Confluence as there's no way to "fix" this behavior without re-enabling the Global Logo, removing the logo, and turning off the logo again.
fields.summary: Related space logo not respecting the on/off settings at the space and global settings level

I already subscribe to this calendar in Apple iCalendar successfully.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50810].
  {panel}

Since the last upgrade, quite a few ppl have reported incorrect dates in the email notifications. Examples:
# Sherif noticed: https://skitch.com/sherif/gcc1s/atlassian-mail-confluence-matt-hodges-updated-an-event-in-the-confluence-product-blogs-calendar-smansour-atlassian.com
# Ryan noticed:
{quote}Hey Sherif,

Looks like there's an issue with diffs with the version of TC running on EAC. Matt changed an event from Dec 8 to Jan 3 and the email renders as such: https://skitch.com/ryan.anderson/gcmta/atlassian-mail-confluence-matt-hodges-updated-an-event-in-the-confluence-product-blogs-calendar-randerson-atlassian.com

Let me know if you have any questions. Thanks.{quote}
# Ian noticed: https://skitch.com/sherif/gcc17/atlassian-mail-fwd-confluence-edwin-wong-updated-an-event-in-the-bonfire-leave-calendar-calendar-smansour-atlassian.com

All these calendars are on EAC.. they all seem to be event updates from what I can tell

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50807].
  {panel}

In the dialog, change the text under the header to say this:
(Keep the heading)

"Embed additional calendars, or modify the look of them by pressing *'Edit'* when selecting this.

When you are ready, ....... "

Main changes:
* reduced the wording so its shorter
* Now that david has implemented the "add new calendars" link in the macro browser, we only need to call out "Edit".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50803].
  {panel}

When upgrading to Confluence 3.5 I backed up all of the calendars (via .ics files) that were found anywhere on my Confluence install. Then I uninstalled the plugin, upgraded Confuence, and installed Team Calendars.

The problem is that the only way I seem to be able to add the calendars back is as one of "my" calendars. I know that they can be embedded in any space, but this is not only annoying for me (to have all calendars that I ported over for my users sitting in my calendars) but it's going to be a political problem if people feel like they have lost control over their calendars.

Please tell me how I can reassign the owners -- a SQL query, some configuration file modification, etc.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Need to reassign calendar ownership to old plugin calendar owners

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50794].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA and Confluence with Team Calendars, and link the two systems
# Create issues and versions in JIRA, with due dates, and resolved dates
# Add a calendar using either Project, Saved Filter or JQL (not relevant to this scenario)
# Select Issue Due Date only to display
#- Observe that the Issue Summary displays, but no Issue Key is displays
# Edit the properties of the Calendar and select Issue Created Date to display as well
#- Observe that now, both Issue Created and Issue Due entries have the Issue Key displayed
# Edit the calendar and select any combination of 2 or more of the 3 Issue Dates
#- Observe that issue keys are displayed
# Edit the calendar and select only one of the Issue Dates
#- Observe that issue keys are not displayed
# Edit the calendar and select only one of the Issue Dates along with the Version Due Date
#- Observe that issue keys are not displayed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50792].
  {panel}

I have installed today Team Calendars to replace the previous used calendar macro that does not work any more in Confluence 4.1.x. I can create a calender in {{My Calendar}}, and add there dates and even import ones from the old Confluence Calendar that I have exported previously. But I am not able to integrate the calendar in a wiki page.

This is what happens when I try to:

# I start in the wiki page, and go into edit mode.
# I then insert `{team` and get as completion option {{Team Calendar}}.
# I select that, and the usual parameters are shown.
# I am able to insert the beginning of an existing calendar, and it is added below.
# I don't see an update on the  left, and when I press {{Refresh}}, I see the message: {{The macro 'calendar' is unknown. It may have been removed from the system.}}
# When I then press {{Insert}}, nothing is inserted in the page.

I have installed the plugin by downloading the jar-file (was not able to find it through plugin manager), I have first disable "Confluence Calendar", and then even deinstalled it, but the result is all the time the same.

----

I have then tried to deinstall the plugin, and reinstall it again, and I was then able to insert the macro in a wiki page successfully. There seems to be a cache for macros that was filled when the old calendar macro was deactivated, but installed, so that there was some conflict. The issue could then be closed for me.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50787].
  {panel}

When you have a Jira Calendar which shows versions, it displays the error {{Jira Calendar Test truncated to show only 1,000 issues events}} even if you have less than 1,000 versions. The limitation should check only the items displayed in the Calendar and not only issues.

+Repro steps:+
# In a Jira project create a few versions in the same month.
# Generate over 1,000 issues for that project in the same month
# In Confluence, add a Jira Calendar and show only _Version Due Date_.

Even if there are less than 1,000 versions, Team Calendars display the error message.

fields.description:
I have installed Team Calendars on our Confluence instance which currently has the old Calendar Plugin v. 2.7.2 installed. (It is not officially supported for Confluence 3.5 but it seems to work anyway). After installation the pages having the old {calendar} macro did not work anymore. Even after disabling the new Team Calendars plugin those pages were still broken, I had to disable/enable the old Calendar plugin to make them work again.

To the user, this problem will look like a data loss of their old calendars.

In my opinion, the new Team Calendars plugin should at least be compatible to the old plugin (as many companies are probably using the old one), ideally there should be a way to migrate all old data into the new calendar.

fields.description:
I'm trying to subscribe to a calendar but get the message that the calender doesn't seem to be in iCal format.

I tested the attached file with these validators:
http://icalvalid.cloudapp.net/
http://severinghaus.org/projects/icv/

and the calendar validates fine, funnily, the last validator makes use of iCal4j which is implemented in Team Calendars as well. Please see the attached log and ics file for more info.


Thanks a lot,
Peter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-50733].
  {panel}

h3.Problem
When you receive a notification from Team Calendars:
{quote}
You are receiving this notification because you are watching the following:
    [Vacations|http://heck.com:8090/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=b8f3a4e6-2065-4400-8cd4-f9347e651730]
{quote}
It will present your link to view them, and will be asked to add this calendar to your with an "Add it now" link.

When you click this link, it will automatically break all your calendars, and you'll be presented with:
{code}
(-) Error(s) occurred.
    500 - 
{code}

There is nothing in the logs

h3.Steps to reproduce (Assuming you already have a working mail server)
# Install Confluence,
# Install Team Calendars
# Create a calendar
# Create an event, and add this event to a user
# This user will receive an mail notification, open it, and the link should be something like:
#* http://heck.com:8090/calendar/previewcalendar.action?subCalendarId=b8f3a4e6-2065-4400-8cd4-f9347e651730
# Add it now
# Voila! 500 error page forever.

h3.Workaround
The workaround as much as it is not perfect it allows the user to still browse the calendar, just access the calendar through the link provided on the mail notification
